servinfo.title: DTC P0123: Throttle Position Sensor (Main) Circuit High

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC P0122: Throttle Position Sensor (Main) Circuit Low .

servinfosub.title: DTC Detecting Condition and Trouble Area

entry.ptxt: Output voltage of throttle position sensor (main) is more than specified value for specified time continuously.

attention3.ptxt: When DTC P0123 and P0223 are indicated together, it is possible that “WHT” wire shorted to power circuit and/or “GRN” wire open.

s1.ptxt: With ignition switch turned OFF, connect scan tool.
Turn ON ignition switch and clear DTC using scan tool.
Keep the accelerator pedal at idle position for 2 seconds.
Keep the accelerator pedal at fully depressed position for 2 seconds.

attention3.ptxt: Before this trouble shooting is performed, read the precautions for DTC troubleshooting referring to Precautions For DTC Troubleshooting .

testgroup.question: Was “Engine and Emission Control System Check” performed?

action.ptxt: Go to Engine and Emission Control System Check .

testgroup.title: Throttle position sensor and its circuit check

test1.ptxt: Connect scan tool to DLC with ignition switch turned OFF.
Turn ON ignition switch, check “TP Sensor 1 Volt” displayed on scan tool when accelerator pedal is idle position and fully depressed.

testgroup.question: Is displayed TP sensor value as described voltage in Scan Tool Data ?

paragroup.ptxt: Check for intermittent referring to Intermittent and Poor Connection Inspection .

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connector from electric throttle body assembly with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection to electric throttle body assembly at “WHT”, “GRN” and “BLK” wire terminals.
If OK, measure voltage between “WHT” wire terminal of electric throttle body assembly connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned ON.
Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “C37-53” terminal.
Measure voltage between “C37-53” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
“WHT” wire is shorted to power circuit.

test1.ptxt: Measure voltage between “BLK” wire terminal of electric throttle body assembly connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned ON.
Turn OFF ignition switch.
Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “C37-53” and “C37-54” terminals.
If OK, measure voltage between “C37-54” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned ON.

action.ptxt: “BLK” wire is open or high resistance circuit.

test1.ptxt: Disconnect connectors from ECM with ignition switch turned OFF.
Measure resistance between “BLK” and “WHT” wire terminals of electric throttle body assembly connector.
Turn ON ignition switch.
Measure voltage between “C37-54” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground.

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
“BLK” wire is shorted to power circuit.

test1.ptxt: Turn OFF ignition switch.
Measure resistance between “GRN” wire terminal of electric throttle body assembly connector and engine ground.
Remove ECM from its bracket with ECM connectors connected.
Check for proper connection of ECM connector at “C37-41” terminal.
Measure resistance between “C37-41” terminal of ECM connector and engine ground with ignition switch turned OFF.

action.ptxt: “GRN” wire is open or high resistance circuit.
Faulty ECM ground circuit. If circuit is OK, substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.

testgroup.title: Electric throttle body assembly check

test1.ptxt: Check throttle pedal position sensor referring to “Throttle Position Sensor Performance Check” under Electric Throttle Body Assembly On-Vehicle Inspection .

testgroup.question: Is output voltage within specified value?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good ECM and recheck.
